title: What is the truth about tesla's free energy? Rumours and zillion internet myths aside, what did he actually mean by free energy? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, Tesla did not intend his Wardenclyffe tower to broadcast energy for free. It was a later, very different method which supposedly provided “energy in unlimited quantity.” Instead, (for the Wardenclyffe tower,) Tesla explained that he would use his “Method of Individuation” to send coded amounts of energy to industrial customers in distant countries. Once a particular order was phoned in, only that one factory would be given the correct “pass key,” and could receive the incoming broadcasts. In an interview, Tesla gave the example of a sugar-factory in Australia phoning in their order, and being sent the megawatts from Niagara Falls tower. From other Tesla comments, this Method of Individuation was probably based on frequency-hopping spread-spectrum, or what’s today called WiFi. (Possibly his mysterious “Static Eliminator” device used this trick.) Notice that FM frequency-modulation “eliminates radio static,” same as WiFi broadband method, where the unwanted thunderstorm emissions cannot duplicate the random hopping. FM radio is a “static eliminator.” Tesla’s device was not FM radio, it appears to be employing a type of naturally-occurring frequency-hopping encode/decode process. Tesla describes that, in his system, a channel-hopping sequence of up to three channels are possibly decodable, but also he mentioned that he’d worked with systems of up to twenty channels; just as unbreakable as a 20-digit combination lock. (Described in a 1912 interview, from Leyland Anderson’s 1992 book “Nikola Tesla on his work …transmission of power.”) Actual Free Energy? Tesla’s “Cosmic energy” claims all date from two decades later: 1933. That’s the year when Tesla finally revealed that he’d discovered a new source of limitless energy. He said that mankind should be very glad that it exists… but he never said what it was. The secret apparently died with him. “I shall not announce the scientific principles of the discovery nor describe the mechanical means I have devised for carrying it out, for the present. It is sufficient at this time to say that I have performed experiments and obtained results from which I am able to calculate what the mechanism may be expected to perform. Much, of course, remains to be accomplished, but it is work not necessarily of a creative kind; it can be done by many, and hence development to the point of actual operation may be enormously speeded up.” (While in its present form the theory calls for the development of the energy in central plants requiring vast machinery, Dr. Tesla said he might be able 	to work out a plan for its use by individual.) - Tesla interviews, 1933In other words, just more rumors and myths, but started by Tesla himself. And when it was suppressed, it was Tesla himself doing the hushing-up. So, if Tesla’s claims weren’t exaggerated, then it means there’s a vast energy source out there, waiting to be tapped, just as soon as human beings stop refusing to give major funding to all the many apparently-crazy crackpot inventors! :) From Tesla’s The Problem of Increasing Human Energy: “The scientific man does not aim at an immediate result. He does not expect that his advanced ideas will be readily taken up. His work is like that of the planter—for the future. His duty is to lay the foundation for those who are to come, and point the way.”“It is not a dream, it is a simple feat of scientific electrical engineering, only expensive. …blind, faint-hearted, doubting world! [...] Humanity is not yet sufficiently advanced to be willingly led by the discoverer's keen searching sense. But who knows? Perhaps it is better in this present world of ours that a revolutionary idea or invention instead of being helped and patted, be hampered and ill-treated in its adolescence …by want of means, by selfish interest, pedantry, stupidity and ignorance; that it be attacked and stifled; that it pass through bitter trials and tribulations, through the strife of commercial existence. So do we get our light. So all that was great in the past was ridiculed, condemned, combated, suppressed — only to emerge all the more powerfully, all the more triumphantly from the struggle." - N.
